---
title: "A More Elaborate Example"
output: html_document
---


```{r prop_test, comment="", echo=TRUE}

smokers  <- c( 80, 84)#, 129, 90)
patients <- c( 86, 93)#, 136, 120)

results <- prop.test(smokers, patients)

estimates <- paste(round(results$estimate * 100,1),"%", collapse=" vs. ", sep="")

p_value <- ifelse(results$p.value < .001, 0.001, round(results$p.value,3))
p_eq_lt <- ifelse(p_value > .001,"=", "<")
p_sig <- ifelse(p_value > .001, "not", "")

```

### Results
This example includes the smoking status from `r length(patients)` groups of patients. ${\chi}^2$ analysis of the proportion of smokers vs non-smokers indicate they are `r p_sig` significantly different between groups (`r estimates`, $p$-value `r paste(p_eq_lt, p_value)`).
